title: First ever app review
text: Let me begin with the cliche I would rate this infinitely lower if I could. I have been an avid and strong supporter of Microsoft for several years; first using it in the United States Navy then School and finally in the professional world, but this app and lack of support is ready to have me retract every good thing I have ever said about the company! I am having an issuing authenticating an account at my school. It is most likely the Schools fault. That being said there is no way to verify this as it is impossible to talk to a Microsoft representative over the phone. It is impossible to access support over chat without logging in to your account! I understand there are millions of problems every single day and it would be difficult for the company to address every single one, but don’t scale your company to the level that exceeds the volume of problems you are willing to address. Money hungry tech companies where CEO’s accumulate billions can’t expend the millions to outsource there trouble shooting it’s despicable and for the first time ever I am taking the time to rate an app and boy is this one a doozie. Shame on Microsoft may God have mercy on your positronic souls!

title: Microsoft’s MFA implementation is flawed…
text:
In 30 years of IT, I don’t think I’ve ever seen the rollout of a relatively new technology go so poorly, even by Microsoft standards.
The app works fine for its intended purpose, but the rollout of MFA is so confused,  haphazard, and poorly documented, that it makes us wish there was an alternative OS ecosystem.
Microsoft attempts to force all users to use Authenticator by default, instead of just a phone # or SMS, which has Admins ripping their hair out; and then the convoluted and myriad workaround suggestions by Microsoft support folks only add to the confusion.
Too big to succeed?

I've got a couple of different O365 accounts that require use of Authenticator regularly. Frequent (1 in 5 attempts) will fail with various error messages even if I enter the correct number. Over and over again. Kill the app. Restart it. Lather.Rinse.Repeat.

title: Absolutely Dreadful, Confusing Experience
text:
I just struggled through adding a new account. The instructions are unclear, the QR code did not work, and the alternative to the QR code, (which requires tryping out a long, confusing URL that appears on the computer screen into the app) is more or less impossible to do. I had to copy the URL into an email, email it to myself, switch from the Authenticator app to my email, open the email, copy of the URL, and then paste it into the Authenticator and and hope that it worked.

I never have such a dreadful, clunky experience with other providers like Google.

title: Warning! It is not possible to restore third party OTP codes
text: I had several accounts set up with Microsoft Authenticator for one time passcode access. My device suddenly died but when I reinstalled Microsoft Authenticator on a new one I discovered that these third party codes aren’t backed up with Microsoft account and have no way to be restored. Now I have to go to each of those accounts and get special support to circumvent the 2FA codes I can no longer access on my broken device. It’s a trap. Highly recommend alternatives which have restoration options

title: DO NOT GET A NEW PHONE
text: I need this app in order to log into my school accounts. It does what it’s supposed to do and doesn’t let you log into an account (in this case my school accounts) without approval from this app. I had gotten a new phone over the weekend and was unable to access my old phone with the authenticator app on it. In order to log into the authenticator app you NEED the authenticator app otherwise you will not be able to log in. There are options to log in without the authenticator app but those two options only include USING THE APP. I never been so frustrated in my life. I am now in the dark till Monday as my school’s help desk is not available Sundays.
